intro: Drepanophyllum, commonly known as the false heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal regions. Drepanophyllum species are evergreen shrubs that can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
